pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
meanings: winning a prize (in a lottery, raffle, etc.)

related.meaning: being in charge (of an area of responsibility)

lessons.japanese: トムが当選する可能性は、たとえあるにしてもごく少ない。
lessons.english: There is little, if any, hope that Tom will win the election.
Her election is in the bag.

lessons.japanese: 彼は当選の見込みが十分ある。
lessons.english: He is in a fair way to being elected.

lessons.japanese: 彼は当選の見込みが十分ある。
lessons.english: He has a good chance of being elected.

lessons.japanese: 彼は当選の見込みが十分ある。
lessons.english: He has a good chance of being chosen.

lessons.japanese: 彼は当選の見込みが十分ある。
lessons.english: There's a good chance that he'll be elected.

lessons.japanese: 彼は当選の見込みが十分ある。
lessons.english: There's a good chance that he'll be chosen.

lessons.japanese: 彼は当選して知事になるつもりだと言った。
lessons.english: He said that he would be elected and that he would become governor.

lessons.japanese: 彼は前回の選挙で上院議員に当選した。
lessons.english: He was elected to the Senate in the last election.

lessons.japanese: 彼はチェスター区選出の議員に当選した。
当選のあかつきには皆様のために一生懸命に働きます。
lessons.english: Once elected, I will do my best for all of you who supported me.

lessons.japanese: 当選したいなら、イメージアップするつもりでないとね。
lessons.english: If you want to get elected, you're going to have to improve your public image.

lessons.japanese: 選挙運動は成功し、彼女は当選した。
lessons.english: The campaign succeeded and she won the election.

lessons.japanese: 選挙運動は成功し、彼女は当選した。
lessons.english: The campaign was successful and she won the election.
